'''RAR''' stands for '''''R'''''oshal '''''AR'''''chive. It is a [[Proprietary format|proprietary]] [[archive file format]] that supports [[data compression]], [[error recovery]], and [[file spanning]].<ref name="rar_eula" /> It was developed by a Russian software engineer, [[Eugene Roshal]] (the first letter of his surname contributing to the name of the archive format), and is currently licensed by ''win.rar GmbH''.<ref>[http://www.win-rar.com/contact.html Contact to win.rar GmbH]</ref>
+
'''RAR''' stands for '''''R'''''oshal '''''AR'''''chive. It is a non-documented [[archive file format]] that supports [[data compression]], [[error recovery]], and [[file spanning]].<ref name="rar_eula" /> It was developed by a Russian software engineer, [[Eugene Roshal]] (the first letter of his surname contributing to the name of the archive format), and is currently licensed by ''win.rar GmbH''.<ref>[http://www.win-rar.com/contact.html Contact to win.rar GmbH]</ref>
The [[filename extension]] used by RAR is <tt>.rar</tt> for the data volume set and <tt>.rev</tt> for the recovery volume set. In previous versions, if a RAR-archive was broken into many smaller files (a "multi-volume archive"), then the smaller files used the extensions <tt>.rar</tt>, <tt>.r00</tt>, <tt>.r01</tt>, <tt>.r02</tt> etc.
The [[filename extension]] used by RAR is <tt>.rar</tt> for the data volume set and <tt>.rev</tt> for the recovery volume set. In previous versions, if a RAR-archive was broken into many smaller files (a "multi-volume archive"), then the smaller files used the extensions <tt>.rar</tt>, <tt>.r00</tt>, <tt>.r01</tt>, <tt>.r02</tt> etc.
